intro: Epipactis intermedia, commonly known as the common helleborine, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its upright, leafy stems and showy, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy coating, while its roots are fibrous and adapted for nutrient absorption. Epipactis intermedia is notable for its ability to thrive in shaded conditions, making it a common sight in forest understories.
